attributes.action: Increase NHS budgets to help acid attack victims
attributes.background: Acid Attack victims face not only physical pain but also mental trauma that should be urgently helped. This can happen if the NHS budget increases so that there are more facilities available for this kind of treatment as the budget cuts to the NHS could hinder these emergencies.
attributes.additional_details: Victims of this heinous crime have to wait due to the lack of facilities to help them because of the NHS budget cut that makes it harder to treat them. Victims have to wait for longer periods of time that could take up to months or even years to book for their own appointments which should not be happening.

attributes.action: Ask the Indian government to take action against the persecution of Christians
attributes.background: India is an ally of the UK and also the world's largest democracy. The UK should ask the Indian government to allow more religious freedom and take action against the rising persecution of Christians at the hands of Hindu radical groups.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.theguardian.com/world/2008/oct/19/orissa-violence-india-christianity-hinduism 

https://www.opendoorsusa.org/christian-persecution/world-watch-list/india/

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Religious_violence_in_Odisha 

https://www.christiantoday.com/article/hindu-extremists-threaten-to-kill-christians-in-india-if-they-utter-the-name-of-christ/63567.htm 

http://www.foxnews.com/world/2016/03/14/christian-persecution-by-hindus-rises-in-india-say-humanitarian-groups.html

attributes.action: Remove multiple minor convictions from DBS from over 10 years ago
attributes.background: If someone has more than one minor offence from over 10 years ago, they still appear on the DBS Disclosure and Barring Service. People are refused jobs as a result, even though there’s nothing serious on there. This means that they unfairly continue to suffer for stupid mistakes made when young.
attributes.additional_details:
There should be an order so that multiple convictions can be removed after 10 years. The major ones should stay on for life, for example, if anyone is on the sex register, someone who has been and are still in prison etc.
 
Convictions staying on of you have more than one is crazy when it’s been over 10 years.

attributes.action: Reconsider licence requirement for small breeders to safeguard endangered breeds
attributes.background: Many dog breeds are endangered and can’t afford to lose breeders. Small breeders with <2 litters yearly in the home are concerned about being unable to meet the expense and requirements of the new licensing laws and may be forced out of business if they chance to make more than £1k in any one year.

attributes.action: Exempt animals purchased from a rescue centre from VAT on vets bills
attributes.background: To discourage unnecessary breeding of animals which are over represented in rescue centres, I am asking that any animal purchased from a rescue centre should be exempt from the 20% VAT on vets’s bills and a corresponding reduction in their insurance premium.
attributes.additional_details:
This would encourage people to buy from rescue centres and discourage the breeding purely for money of those breeds which are over represented in rescue centres.
Owners would register proof of purchase from a recognised rescue centre with their vet and have their record marked as exempt from VAT.

attributes.action: Ban food waste food away require companies to give it to people who need it
attributes.background: Many companies around the UK throw away waste food at the end of the day away. This needs to stop and the food should be given to people who need it the most, for example homeless people.
attributes.additional_details: In 2016 France banned food waste and made it compulsory for supermarkets to donate unsold food to charities. The UK government should enact a similar law.

attributes.action: Introduce unlimited compassionate leave for those with terminally ill relatives
attributes.background: My mother at the beginning of 2018 became seriously ill, and was admitted to hospital. Work was very good about it and gave me compassionate leave so I could go and see her
attributes.additional_details:
6/8/2018 I was told mum had only days left to live, but I was told I couldn’t have compassionate leave as I was not entitled to any and would have to phone in sick. 

I think it’s disrespectful not to be given compassionate leave for a dying relative, my mum passed that week. And basically lost two weeks wages. I think this is wrong for anyone to go through.

Unlimited compassionate leave for those with terminally ill relatives, would solve this issue for a lot of people.

attributes.action: Make it the law that truck  drivers have air con in their sleeping areas.
attributes.background: My son is a truck driver and he all his colleagues are really feeling unsafe in this heat. Currently company owners do not have to ensure the sleeping area is cooled. There have been reports of cab temperatures reaching in excess of 50 degrees. We wouldn’t do this to a dog, let’s not do it to them

attributes.action: Make practicing beauty/nail/hairdressing treatments without insurance illegal
attributes.background: There are thousands of unlicensed and uninsured treatments being carried out in beauty every day by untrained people . This puts the public at risk due to various chemicals used and takes business from qualified professionals who have spent years and thousands on training and insurance.
attributes.additional_details: Use of social media has made it easy for untrained freelance therapists, make up artists, technicians and hairdressers to promote themselves to the public who are unaware of the risks they are taking when using these services. Many do not even hold mandatory public liability insurance meaning that any damages or reactions caused by improper use of products and chemicals is uncovered. This puts the public in danger of life-changing deformities by negligence of the persons performing treatments.

attributes.action: Urge newly elected PM Imran Khan to stop persecution of Ahmadi Muslims
attributes.background: All over the world a small sect of Muslims known as the Ahmadiyya Muslim Community are persecuted and oppressed. Perhaps no other place do Ahmadis face worse persecution than in Pakistan.
attributes.additional_details:
In Pakistan oppressive laws mean Ahmadis often live in fear and are denied basic rights. Ahamadis cannot vote, their mosques are often targeted, for example, in 2010 where 86 Ahmadi worshippers were killed during Friday prayers and they can face up to 3 years in jail for calling themselves Muslims. 

Pakistan has just elected a new PM. PM Khan says that he want an just and equal society. There is now a golden opportunity for the UK Government to pressure Khan to address the persecution of Ahmadis.

attributes.action: To set up a scheme to support banks and building societies who offer 95% LTV
attributes.background: I would like call upon the Government to set up a scheme to support banks and building societies who offer 95 -98 % LTV mortgages to tenants who have been renting for 36 months or more to be able to obtain a mortgage.
attributes.additional_details:
More than 3,700 homes are standing empty in Leicester and Leicestershire.
Latest figures obtained by the BBC show that 1,336 homes are unoccupied in the city and a further 2,372 around the county are also currently not lived in.
A further 183 in Rutland are also empty.
We have also become a nation of renters, with rents higher then some mortgage payments, tenants should be able to buy on the open market esp First time Home buyers.

attributes.action: alter law so that biological parents are legal guardian of their surrogate child
attributes.background: In the UK, the worrying thing about using your own embryo (which is biologically yours and your partners DNA) is that the surrogate is the legal guardian and can keep the child once born, if they decide to. I find this a scary thought after struggling to have my own child and considering surrogacy.
attributes.additional_details: If the embryo is biologically from the couple struggling with fertility and they choose to use a surrogate, there should be a law in place to say that baby is theirs legally and that the surrogate cannot keep the child once born. Couples struggling with infertility have enough to worry about without having their hopes dashed by a surrogate mother who may suddenly decide she doesn't want to part with the child once born, which would be devastating if the couple are biologically the 'real' parents

attributes.action: Make it a requirement for supermarket delivery vehicles to be fully electric.
attributes.background: Make it a legal requirement for the big six supermarket retailers in the UK (Tesco's, Sainsbury's, Adsa, Morrisons, Waitrose and Iceland.) to have a fleet of fully electric delivery vehicles by April 2019.
attributes.additional_details: As supermarket delivery vehicles only deliver/operate in city they are based in and surrounding towns & villages they rarely have to travel long distances which means that they would never be too far away from a charging point and when the vehicles are not being used (overnight ect) they can be charged at the supermarket ready for their next job. The electrification of delivery vehicles would help lower pollution levels and help save the earth.

attributes.action: Create a single register of eligible voters managed by the Electoral Commission
attributes.background:
Currently local registration offices manage over 350 electoral rolls in the UK.

This petition calls for creation of a single register to be managed by the independent Electoral Commission.

Such a register would help promote public confidence in the democratic process and ensure its integrity.

attributes.action: Horn honking/sexual slurs shouted out of car windows to women to be an offence.
attributes.background: The majority of women while in public have to endure multiple forms of harassment, from horn honking to misogynistic sexual slurs shouted out of vehicle windows, whether travelling to work or visiting local shops women endure constant verbal harassment. All women should feel safe on our streets.
attributes.additional_details: My personal experience has a 20 year old women living on a main road traveling the 30 minute journey to work I receive upwards of 3 vocal forms of sexual harassment I am made to feel like a piece of meat. Why should this injustice which has occurred for generations in our society be accepted. An online form where victims of this behaviour can report offending vehicle registration numbers to the local authority and a sanction procedure should be in place to prevent these acts being committed.

attributes.action: Government to amend rules so GPs can charge Solicitors for postage for SAR.
attributes.background: GDPR has put a financial burden of £25 for postage on GP Practices for Subject Access Requests (SAR) for litigation cases from Solicitors. Solicitors are capitalising on this as opposed to requesting Access To Medical Records which carries a fee. GP time to remove sensitive data is not recoverable.
attributes.additional_details:
Historically practices could charge up to £50.00 to cover the consumables and postage charges. 
Solicitors are requesting information under a SAR request despite it clearly being for litigation. Patients are consenting to full medical records which under data protection is excessive in line with the Caldecott principals.

attributes.action: Require CCJs to be sent by recorded post
attributes.background: CCJs are just sent by normal post. If these are not received or sent to a previous address they are just entered against you. This is completely unfair which if you find out you have one, you then have to pay to get it set aside as you had no chance of defence. This needs to change.
attributes.additional_details: These need to at least be sent by recorded post and not entered if they are not received.

attributes.action: Mandatory Mental Health First Aid Training for Children's/Youth Workers
attributes.background: Compulsory Mental Health First Aid Training for Children's/Youth workers will ensure that leaders know what to do if a young person is experiencing a mental health crisis. By recognising the signs early and knowing what to do in each circumstance, leaders can create greater safety for young people.
attributes.additional_details: If a young person grazes their knee, or breaks their ankle while on a residential, noticing the symptoms and treating the problem can be simple for a first aider. If a mental health crisis occurs, the issue may be troublesome to overcome if a leader is not trained in mental health first aid. 1 in 10 young people experience a mental health issue at a given time (https://mhfaengland.org/individuals/youth/) yet the subject is still stigmatised and brushed under the carpet. https://mhfaengland.org/

attributes.action: Make it illegal to force staff to use their own credit card for company expenses
attributes.background:
More and more companies force / require employees to use their own funds and/or credit cards to fund company expenditure and to then claim back this expenditure after the fact.

The company's liability is then carried by the employee. 

The employee is responsible to the credit card company.
attributes.additional_details:
Companies then take weeks to pay the expenses - and in a lot of cases refuse to pay interest - forcing the employee to fund the expenses through their own current account (to avoid the expenses charge).
 
Having these expenses hidden makes the company’s balance sheet look more favourable than it is.
 
It is an abuse of the company’s power and when employees challenge it they are told there is no choice; no other option.

attributes.action: Provide higher maintenance loans and make students eligible for benefits
attributes.background:
As per DWP, full - time Students in the UK are currently not entitled to any benefits and are solely dependant on their maintenance loan.

Part-time students may claim limited universal credit and it is hard for them to find part-time work as employer preference remains full-time employment.
attributes.additional_details:
Maintenance Loans are 100% repayable.
Should cover rent + bills + school expenses but is not enough to cover even rent if studying in London.

Part of the maintenance loan is supposed to go towards school expenses - for Art students, this is a particularly large sum.

DWP add the full loan amount into their calculations as income, they do not take substantial expenses, such as deposit towards housing, into consideration as an expense for the student.

It has become a privileged situation to be able to study in this country and this shouldn't be the case when studying towards your first degree. Those who haven't got parents to rely on to fill in the gaps in their budgets and are struggling to find part-time jobs are left with no options.

attributes.action: Stop foreign aid to countries richer than we are.
attributes.background: Britain can no longer afford to maintain foreign aid. We send billions abroad when it could be better spent on helping our own citizens. We should stop sending money to countries that have a higher GDP than the UK.

attributes.action: Free up empty MOD housing stock to homeless ex services staff .
attributes.background:
MOD homes standing empty across UK. 
More than 11,000 Ministry of Defence homes across the UK are empty, costing the taxpayer more than £25m a year in rent and maintenance.
These homes could be used to accommodate homeless ex service staff.

attributes.action: Pay all employed Carers the Living Wage
attributes.background: Caring, in our life time we will all require a need for caring, either for ourselves or for a person close to us. Carers need to work on Person-Centred Care principals via the Care Support Plan.
attributes.additional_details:
Their responsibilities are intimate personal care, washing, dressing, meal preparation, Financial management, Emotional support, Safeguarding, Daily planning, Social inclusion, Wellbeing, respect and dignity in a personalised, dignified manner, respect for property and items within that property. National Living Wage is £7.83 and the Living Wage is £9.00. Pay rates need to reflect the responsibilities, pay Carers the Living Wage.

The Care Industry is hanging by a thread. In 2015, Carers UK found that Family Carers save the UK economy £132 billion a year and that if even a small proportion of Family Carers were unable to carry on caring, the economic effect would be “catastrophic”. We need to attract more people to the caring professional by paying the Living Wage.

attributes.action: Strengthen laws & policies on terror suspects and those linked to terror groups
attributes.background: The UK and the European Union as a whole need to strengthen policies and laws on those individuals linked to terrorism. It is clear that close surveillance on those individuals is failing the public as a whole.
attributes.additional_details: The deaths at the Manchester Arena bombing and most recently the decapitation of two tourists in Morocco by a group which was known to have close ties to ISIS. We need new laws that allow authorities to hold suspects for unlimited time until thorough investigations have been taken, there should also be strengthened laws on allowing imprisonment and deportation ( in cases of foreign criminals) to be authorised. The rights to live a life without fear and the duty to protect the public interest heavily outweighs the rights of the individual.

attributes.action: Transition the United Kingdom into a federation of constitutional republics
attributes.background: Abolish the monarchy and reform the United kingdom into a federation of constitutional republics

attributes.action: Amend Universal Credit regulations so it can cover 53 week periods
attributes.background: Universal Credit (UC) is paid monthly to Landlords. If rent is paid weekly, the monthly rate is worked out by multiplying the weekly rent by 52, then dividing by 12.
attributes.additional_details:
However, every 5-7 years some landlords charge for 53 weeks! So UC Claimants lose out 1 whole week of rent! This is unfair to Claimants and Landlords!
 
I quote from UC website: "Universal Credit will always be calculated based on a 52 week year, unless rent is charged over fewer than 52 weeks".
 
https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/universal-credit-and-rented-housing--2/universal-credit-and-rented-housing-guide-for-landlords
 
This issue has been raised a few times directly with Universal Credit, but they are adamant they will only pay for 52 weeks! This needs to be raised for a discussion by the Parliament. Help me reach 100,000 signs!

attributes.action: Hard Remain: Align with other EU countries and adopt Schengen and the euro.
attributes.background: Many people are unhappy with the various varieties of brexit that are on the table. But many are also unhappy with the current membership of the EU. Another option would be for a "hard remain". The UK should become part of the Schengen area, adopt the euro currency, and adopt EU driving standards.

attributes.action: Recognise in DWP assessments that depression and anxiety are debilitating
attributes.background: I suffer severe depression and anxiety, yet the DWP deem me to be fit for work. I have been refused every benefit I've applied for based on a medical assessment in 2015. I'm certain there are thousands of others in similar positions.
attributes.additional_details: The Government should ensure medical assessments recognise the impact of these illness when assessing peoples’ fitness to work.

attributes.action: Increase funding for mental health services and accommodation for veterans
attributes.background: Thousands of ex-military personnel are currently either homeless or suffering with mental health issues. It is diabolical that people who have served this country are being left behind in such a manner; it is high time for the government to start actively tackling this crisis.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.mirror.co.uk/news/uk-news/least-13000-hero-soldiers-left-11847000

https://www.bbc.com/news/health-45761546

attributes.action: Allow first time buyers to use their pension savings as a deposit for mortgage
attributes.background: It is very difficult to save up the money and sometimes unrealistic.

attributes.action: Say NO to meat tax
attributes.background: Do not consider imposing additional taxes on meat products. Introducing a product specific tax will only serve to penalise the poor. Instead of reducing consumer choices, it would be more beneficial to educate the public about the impact on their health and environment.
attributes.additional_details:
There are examples in the past which show that these sorts of taxes are just another way of extracting more money from the public. Rarely do they have the full desired effect on consumption.
Furthermore, meat is not the leading cause of heart disease or global warming, thus it would make more sense to target those sectors.

attributes.action: Government to ban the production and use of all non-recyclable plastic by 2020.
attributes.background: Plastic is choking each and every one of us.  It has filled the land, sea and air. We may not want to accept it but it is in our face. We would like the government to take the initiative to stop the production so it is not available for use in UK and other countries will follow.
attributes.additional_details:
A Roadmap for Sustainability report found more than 60 countries have introduced bans which are one of the most effective ways to reduce the use of disposable plastic.
Plastic items can take up to 1000 years to decompose in landfills. But plastic bags we use in our everyday life take 10-1000 years to decompose, burning it is not an option as well as it releases toxic fumes into the air.
UN warned at current levels the earth could be awash with 12 billion tonnes of plastic trash by the middle of the century.

attributes.action: Sensory Therapy to be offered in all areas
attributes.background:
My son has been denied sensory therapy recently, due to it not being commissioned in our area. This is due to there not being enough research to prove it's needed. 
My child, along with thousands of others need sensory therapy just as much as everyone needs access to a GP. 

This needs to change
attributes.additional_details:
I have written to the commisioners but had no joy, therefore I have taken this to the parliamentary ombudsman and I want to get as many signatures as possible to support my case and get our voices heard. 

Please sign. It takes 2 minutes but could help children for a lifetime.

attributes.action: Protect British food and drink in future trade deals
attributes.background: I would like the Government to act now and introduce legislation that ensures protected designation of origin (PDO), protected geographical indication (PGI), and traditional specialities guaranteed (TSG), remain a part of the British food and drink industry post Brexit.
attributes.additional_details: I urge you to back British business and sign our petition that will help promote our vital food and drink industries.

attributes.action: Require school housing facilities (boarding houses) to provide recycling bins
attributes.background: Young minds should be taught the importance of protecting the planet so it is there for future generations.In the countryside the evidence of humans encroaching on the environment is very clear. Schools have the ability to change the minds of the future and should use this ability for our benefit.
attributes.additional_details: School’s with an average of 650 pupils plus staff produces a lot of waste annually. That waste should be disposed of correctly and safely.Up to 60% of the rubbish that ends up in the bin could be recycled and isn’t. Also, there is 260 million tons of plastic produced each year (globally), about 10 percent ends up in our oceans. This plastic can take between 450-1000 years to decompose.

attributes.action: Allow UK students to use student loans within the EU - OR lower tuition fees
attributes.background: The conservative government in power should allow UK students to use their student loans to study at universities within the EU after Brexit OR lower our tuition fee's to minimize out debt for an education we surely need if the country is going to function without EU professional workers.
attributes.additional_details:
The freedom of information responses compiled by the Liberal Democrats from 80 of the 136 NHS acute trusts in England shows that 2,700 EU nurses left the health service in 2016, compared to 1,600 EU nurses in 2014 – a 68% increase.

If leaving the EU means letting go of many of our much-needed professionals, the UK university tuition fees need to either be lowered or student loans need to allow our youth to study where it's cheaper.

The average student debt at graduation is £50,800 - source IFS.

Do we really expect our youngest and brightest to thrive with that much debt on their shoulders?

attributes.action: Jeremy Hunt to make full apology for comparing the EU and Soviet Union
attributes.background: The foreign secretary, Jeremy Hunt, has been rebuked by the European Commission for a speech at the Conservative party conference where he seemed to compare the European Union to the Soviet Union. Such remarks are damaging to Britain as a nation and particularly so coming from the Foreign Secretary.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.theguardian.com/politics/2018/oct/01/jeremy-hunt-draws-eu-ire-over-soviet-prison-comparison

attributes.action: Ban the use of horses within the police force
attributes.background: We want to ban the use of horses within the police force. Often the horses are put into dangerous and uncontrolled situations such as football games or marches which leads to distress for the animal. The horse is being exploited and is not having the freedom which we have and take for granted.
attributes.additional_details: I recently witnessed a Police horse struggling to walk, looking in pain along with acting distressed as it walked down a busy main road in Manchester. It is unfair and there are other means the Police could have used such as bikes, as this was a quiet Wednesday evening there was no need to have the horse out. The policeofficer was not able to control the situation in a calm & effective manner to which the horse would be taken out of the dangerous situation for both the horse and the public.

attributes.action: Scrap Vehicle Excise Duty and raise excise duty on fuel.
attributes.background: Instead of wasting valuable police resources chasing untaxed drivers, when they should be tackling more serious crime, scrap VED and add 10 pence to the price of a litre of fuel. That way, the more you drive the more you pay.
attributes.additional_details: We all know that manufacturer's fuel consumption figures are very unreliable. This way people will pay the fair amount due in tax based on their consumption and their mileage. It doesn't penalise the drivers who have to have a car because bus services in their rural area are non- existent and without a car they wouldn't be able to get to hospitals for appointments or to the shop for essentials.

attributes.action: Call for an immediate halt to the offense on Idlib and an international debate
attributes.background:
Our prime minister must join those applying pressure on Russia and Iran to stop such an onslaught. Apply pressure on the UN to do what it can in calling for diplomacy. 
Find ways to help the civilians to protect themselves and deal with the humanitarian disaster which looms.
attributes.additional_details: Let us not stand by and watch whilst another humanitarian crisis unfolds. We must raise our voices in opposition!

attributes.action: Appeal for the UN to ban Lethal Autonomous Weapons
attributes.background: Countries across the world are on the verge to finish artificially intelligent weapons by 2019. These machines will result in unfathomable consequences that humans cannot foresee. International legislation must be pressured by the UK to keep up to date before the technology is finished and utilised.
attributes.additional_details:
https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lethal_autonomous_weapon

https://autonomousweapons.org

https://futureoflife.org/2018/04/30/lethal-autonomous-weapons-an-update-from-the-united-nations/?cn-reloaded=1

https://www.janes.com/article/79311/china-s-shock-call-for-ban-on-lethal-autonomous-weapon-systems

attributes.action: For victims of crime to have rights to appeal a not guilty verdict.
attributes.background: After taking my abusers to court, they were found not guilty. We should have rights like the person found guilty has fair justice. If the person's found guilty they can appeal against the sentence or case. Victims should have a proper right to appeal.
attributes.additional_details: And when the CPS and police mess your case up, like mine, there should be the right for victims to appeal. There is not enough space to put everything on. But I reach out to other victims and people in England to, get a fair justice system for now and in the future. With rights other victims may come forward.

attributes.action: Stop playing Vivaldi as hold music on the benefit enquiries line.
attributes.background: Whilst it is understandable that businesses do need waiting music to occupy the minds of enquirers, playing Vivaldi's 'Spring' over and over again creates associations incompatible with the normal levels of appreciation that one should have for such a classical musician.
attributes.additional_details: Several benefit numbers spout the same song over and over again. After 15 minutes one becomes irked. After 20 minutes, the music has slightly disturbing undertones and after 30 minutes the listener turns exasperated, frantic and starts to shout at their handset. This is not ideal: it breeds frustration and resentment at Vivaldi, the benefits line and possibly the government as a whole.

attributes.action: Lower the percentage for child maintenance deductions from earnings
attributes.background: The current cms payment scheme for non resident parents has a massive impact on non resident working people that are paying rent and bills for their current living situation. A drop in pay or overtime no less than 25 % will leave you with nothing to pay rent and bills.
attributes.additional_details: Non resident fathers will be left in financial difficulty with the cms payment scheme and would be forced to leave work this is not good for the kids that need money.

attributes.action: Place a ban on companies demanding experience for 'factory floor' jobs.
attributes.background: Coffee houses, supermarkets, clothes stores and others demand experience to work on tills, stock shelves and make drinks. The average person can cook, clean, hang laundry and treat people decently. So, why do these daily tasks, skills and experiences need to be gained from previous employment?
attributes.additional_details:
If education is the key to a better life, then why is 'work experience' the lock keeping people barren. This may predominantly affect millennials, but it affects others too. There are people who want to work, but get rejected; when they just want to give back to society. 

If I can't obtain a job, due to a lack of work/job-related experience. Yet, to obtain work/job-related experience, I need a job. However, an employer won't hire me; due to a lack of work/job-related experience. Then the system becomes a punishment for those who desire knowledge and to be better & productive members of society.

attributes.action: Condemn the Bangladeshi Government's violent crackdown on student protests.
attributes.background: The protests demanding more stringent road safety, were triggered when 2 students were killed by a speeding bus.The student-led protests are being targeted by state-sponsored violence. Bangladesh's government has also shut down access to mobile internet in many parts of the country in response.
attributes.additional_details:
The Telegraph and the BBC have noted the use of rubber bullets by the police. Online evidence, being shared by the protesters, also point to sexual assault and violent attacks carried out by the student wing of the ruling party, Awami League and the authorities.
Per the WHO, there are 20,000 road fatalities every year in Bangladesh. The government's violent crackdown is thought to be fueled by fears of anti-government sentiments leading up to the general election.

attributes.action: Make it legal in England to marry in a forest as it legal in Scotland
attributes.background: My son and his fiancee would like as would possibly many others to marry in a forest. Please help to try and make this happen

attributes.action: Give the option for ‘None of the Above’ on the ballot paper at the next Gen Elec
attributes.background: The Brexit debacle has highlighted how poor the U.K. has been managed. The two party system really doesn’t allow people to feel represented. Many people voted in the EU Ref as a protest against the Westminster bubble. The electorate deserve change to our political system. It is broken

attributes.action: Stop people buying animals for Christmas then getting rid of them,
attributes.background: Anyone getting an animal should be made to have a licence, as well as the animal being chipped, 1,000 pound fine for anyone who decides to just dump there animal, or imprisonment. Also a 5,000 pound license for animal breaders and only 2 litters aloud. All puppy kittens to be chipped.

attributes.action: Regulate fitness professional qualifications and ban fast track courses.
attributes.background: The fitness industry is suffering from underqualifed and inexperienced people masquerading as “professionals” due to fast track courses. We ask For a set standard for the qualification of both “fitness instructor” and “personal trainer” positions to avoid public injury and dangerous misinformation.
